pdf_title: Exploration of health-related quality of life, anxiety and depression in antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody-associated vasculitis
title: Exploration of health-related quality of life, anxiety and depression in antineutrophil cytoplasmic antibody-associated vasculitis
short_description: A cross-sectional study examining health-related quality of life, anxiety, depression, and fatigue in patients with ANCA-associated vasculitis using validated questionnaires.
long_description: This clinical research study investigates the psychological and quality of life impacts of ANCA-associated vasculitis (AAV), a group of chronic inflammatory conditions affecting small blood vessels. Using standardized assessment tools including the EuroQoL questionnaires, Hospital Anxiety and Depression Score, and Multidimensional Assessment of Fatigue questionnaire, researchers analyzed how factors such as disease activity, duration, age, and gender influence patient outcomes. The study identified four distinct patient clusters with varying levels of health-related quality of life and psychological distress, revealing that these impacts persist throughout the disease course but vary significantly based on clinical and demographic factors. The findings emphasize the need for continuous multiprofessional support and suggest that EQ-VAS may be more effective than EQ-5D-index for distinguishing patient subgroups with different quality of life levels.
